We are going to create some figures that gives us information about the Corona-pandemic in 2020 (Covid-19). The figures contains;
  1) A figure with six graphs containing the confirmed and deaths for China, The Netherlands, the USA and the American Territories and the World
  2) A figure with three lines that represents the amount of new positive Corona patients for the three countries each day
  3) A figure with three lines that represents the amount of new deaths due to Corona for the three countries each day
  4) A figure with three lines that represents the amount of total (cumulative) positive Corona patients for the three countries each day
  5) A figure with three lines that represents the amount of total (cumulative) deaths due to Corona for the three countries each day
  6) Eighth figures with the same information, a line that represents the amount of cases (confirmed or deaths) and a dotted blue line that indicates the average
    6.1) New confirmed cases in the world
    6.2) New confirmed cases in The Netherlands
    6.3) New confirmed cases in the United States and the American Territories
    6.4) New confirmed cases in China
    6.5) New death cases in the world
    6.6) New death cases in The Netherlands
    6.7) New death cases in the United States and the American Territories
    6.8) New death cases in China


First we make a figure with six plots that gives us information about amount of Corona patients and deaths in the three countries, we don't use the data for the world in this figure. First, note that the y-axis is in log 10 scale and divided by ten. In the left upper corner we see a plot with the data for China and confirmed cases. Below that plot is again the confirmed data but for The Netherlands (NL), and below that plot in the lower left corner we see again the confirmed but for the USA. On the right side it is the same but instead of the confirmed cases we see the deaths.

We see that the plots for China, confirmed and deaths, starts at january 18 2020 and the lines for The Netherlands and the USA starts at march 6 2020 and march 3 2020. We know that COVID-19 originated in China, so the first cases are reported in China, but it is likely that in the USA and in The Netherlands were cases before the first reported cases.
We see that the line that indicates the confirmed cases in China was decreasing for a long period, but that the line is now increasing again. China has no deaths reported for a long period, but some institutions and persons specialized in pandemics has their doubts when it comes to China's reported information about the Corona-pandemic.
When we look at the confirmed line for The Netherlands we see that it looks like The Netherlands controlled the pandemic, but since mid july the line is increasing again. The line that indicates the deaths is also decreasing, but instead of the increase since mid july, this line is still decreasing and has reached zero again. So the question is; are we going to see the increase in the confirmed cases line back in the death cases line or not?
Now the United States and the American Territories. When we are going to determine the USA's share in the Worlds amount of Corona cases, we will get the following calculation for the confirmed cases: USA has almost 4.5 million confirmed cases and over the world there are 16.6 million confirmed cases. So the USA has a share of almost 30 percent. When we do the same but for the deaths the USA has a share of almost 22 percent. When we take a look at the plots for the USA we can explain those numbers. Where the lines for China and The Netherlands are/were decreasing the USA's lines are only increasing. So we can predict that the shares are only getting bigger because were the other countries reported cases getting smaller every day, the USA's reported cases gets bigger every day.

```{r facet figure with confirmed and deaths for the three countries and the world, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
DB1_days_amount_sort_country %>% filter(vector_country %in% c("NL", "USA", "China")) %>% ggplot(aes(vector_days, vector_amount_case/10, group = 1)) + theme_bw() + geom_line(color = "blue") + facet_grid(vector_country ~ vector_sort_case) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 60, vjust = 1, hjust = 1)) + scale_y_continuous(trans = "log10") + scale_x_discrete(breaks = some_days, labels = some_days) + xlab("Days, notation month-day-year (01 18 2020 is january 18 2020)") + ylab("Amount of cases * 10, log 10 scale") + ggtitle("4 plots that gives information to compare, note that the Y-axis is in log 10") 
```
